text.section: The Department of Health and Mental Hygiene and the Department of General Services shall cooperate with and assist the Department in carrying out the purposes of this Part VIII of this subtitle.

section.section:
The Department of General Services shall:
construct or acquire the required space to be used by the child care center, which space shall be submetered for utilities and the costs of which shall be paid by the child care center; and
inspect the facility monthly and inform child care center personnel of maintenance deficiencies to be corrected by the child care center.

If any deficiencies under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection are not corrected within a reasonable time, the Department of General Services shall notify the State Department of Education which will exact compliance in accordance with the terms of the child care center contract.
The child care center shall pay for any costs of operation of the child care center.

text.section:
Space originally set aside for a child care center may be used for other purposes if:
the building has been fully occupied for 180 days; and
an application to operate a child care center has not been filed under Part VII of this subtitle.
Children of State employees shall have priority over other children in admission to a child care center in a State-occupied building or nearby buildings.

section.section: After a child care center for children of State employees has been established, the Department shall assess the child care needs of the State employees using the center at least every 5 years.
If the assessment demonstrates that the service is no longer needed or feasible, the State Superintendent may close the center.
The State Superintendent shall give the child care center 90 days' written notice of closure.
